content: In the tightly monitored city of Stenograd, where daily life is guided by the omnipresent Behavioral Compliance Index, order unravels after Marek Halden—the architect of this silent, data-driven regime—is found mysteriously dead in his sealed apartment. As the automated government falters, Sven Halek, tormented by truth and loyalty, releases explosive evidence of the Council’s sabotage and the BCI’s corrupt origins. The city erupts in outrage as secrets of rigged data, political erasures, and abuse come to light, shattering public trust. Mass demonstrations swell, Council factions turn on each other, and resignation sweeps through the administration. With authority crumbling, citizens and resistance groups seize the moment to coordinate vital services themselves, openly rejecting algorithmic control and breathing life into a chaotic but hopeful new era of self-governance.
